two #12-french red rubber robinson catheters were placed, 1 in each nasal passage, and brought out through the oral cavity and clamped over a dental gauze roll on the upper lip to provide soft palate retraction.

the anterior tonsillar pillar was infiltrated with 1.5 cc of 1% xylocaine with 1:100,000 epinephrine, as was the left tonsillar pillar.

the right tonsil was grasped with the tenaculum and retracted out of its fossa.
by a similar procedure, the opposite tonsillectomy was performed and the fossa was packed.
bleeding was then similarly controlled in the left tonsillar fossa and the nasopharynx after removal of the packs.
the nasal passages and oropharynx were suctioned free of debris.
the patient tolerated the procedure well and left the operating room in good condition.
